newsItem.headline: Shiro Kurita named First Citizen of Galedon
newsItem.desc: At 26 years old, the Lord of Yamashiro, Shiro Kurita, declared himself New Samarkand’s First Citizen. While many claim his path to success is rife with blackmail and assassinations, Shiro responds by saying he only ever follows The way of the samurai.

newsItem.headline: Admiral James McKenna Made Fleet Admiral of the Alliance Navy
newsItem.desc: Admiral James McKenna has been promoted to Fleet Admiral following the retirement of his predecessor, leaving him in control of the Alliance Navy. We at TNS wish Fleet Admiral McKenna the best of luck with his new position.

newsItem.headline: Under the auspices of the Skye Traders, the Federation of Skye is born
newsItem.desc: Ian McQuiston, of Terran birth, has formed an interstellar government known as the Federation of Skye, based on its namesake planet. The new faction will offer military defense and political power to the worlds ruled by his trading organization, the Sky Traders.

newsItem.headline: Launch of the WarShip Dreadnought
newsItem.desc: There was only one opinion among those who were present at the launching of the Dreadnought today, and that was expressed in the three words "a great success." The ceremony was indeed a success from every point of view, and will long live in the memory of all who were privileged to be spectators of it, sadly few they may have been. At the ceremony's conclusion Fleet Admiral McKenna declared the creation of an Alliance Navy that all can be proud of, with the TAS Dreadnought as the resurgent fleet's flagship.

newsItem.headline: The Alliance of Galedon is formed
newsItem.desc: Director of the newly-formed Alliance of Galedon, Shiro Kurita, aims to defend the nascent faction from the Ozawa Mercantile Association, the dominant economic power in the region. The Galedonian government hopes with this move to break the tight control OWA has on this major colony.

newsItem.headline: First full-scale interstellar invasion in history under way!
newsItem.desc: Troops from New Samarkand and Galedon V have invaded the planet Sverdlovsk. After months of rebuffed diplomatic efforts by Alliance of Galedon's Director Shiro Kurita, diplomatic tactics gave way to military expansion as the Alliance tries in one swoop to permanently remove the rival trading company Ozawa Mercantile Association and add a new world to its growing empire.

newsItem.headline: Maxwell Rowe is named First Consul of the Rim Worlds Republic
newsItem.desc: Maxwell Rowe, the third son of the Republic's founder Hector Rowe, used his father's classical concerns against the aging First Consul by ordering a vote of no confidence. Maxwell swiftly positioned himself as the second First Consul following Hector's suicide.

newsItem.headline: War breaks out between the Capellan Hegemony and the Sarna Supremacy
newsItem.desc: Experts had warned that war was inevitable between the two powers since the worlds of Palos and Wei declared themselves to be independent. Prime Magnate of the Capellan Hegemony Paula Aris, rebuked a taunting letter from Premier Casin Chandler of the Supremacy, which was apparently the spark of the conflict. There are reports that the Prime Magnate was already preparing for war against the evil empire of the Sarna Supremacy and is using the missive to give legitimacy to her cause.

newsItem.headline: The Dart-class Light Cruiser enters service in the Terran Alliance
newsItem.desc:
The Dart-class of ships was developed by Di Tron Heavy Industries for the Terran Navy and is intended for independent duty.

The ship's construction features very sizable fuel tanks and a cargo bay that accounts for more than 15% of the ship's total mass. Six drop collars are incorporated into the hull to handle the larger military and civilian class DropShips. Even though it's not the largest WarShip, it is large enough to have enhanced structural integrity that is uncommon for WarShips of its size.

newsItem.headline: The Free Worlds League enters the fray!
newsItem.desc: To the surprise of many, the struggling Capellan Hegemony added the forces of the FWL to help the fight against the Sarna Supremacy. The details of the arrangement with Danak Selaj, the newly-appointed Captain-General of the Free Worlds League, have not been made public. Prime Magnate Paula Aris hopes to bring the war to a swift end by using greater numbers as an advantage. The decision is being both lauded and vilified by military experts across the Inner Sphere.

newsItem.headline: Tikonov Grand Union forces capture the world of Almach from the Marlette Association
newsItem.desc: Having been a contentious focus of conflict between the Tikonov Grand Union and the Marlette Association, the (former) independent world of Almach has now been declared captured by the Tikonov Grand Union, as part of an apparent greater military operation against the Association.

newsItem.headline: The Tikonov Grand Union withdraws from Mira after the death of Diana Chinn
newsItem.desc: As the Tikonov Grand Union military was making good advances in Mira against Marlette forces, Commander Diana Chinn died from, at the moment, unexplained reasons. As a result of this setback, Tikonov forces withdrew from the planet.

newsItem.headline: The Capellan Hegemony and Sarna Supremacy sign peace!
newsItem.desc:
After a disastrous naval battle at the Liao system, Free World League support vanished and the Capellan offensive cracked. The end result was a peace agreement between the two warring parties that disbanded the Capellan Hegemony, to be substituted for a more representative government.

A week after the peace agreement was signed, Paula Aris committed suicide.

newsItem.headline: Lucien Davion is elected Prime Minister of New Avalon
newsItem.desc: The son of New Avalon Ambassador Jerome Davion and Jennifer DuVall, Lucien Davion was elected to the office of Prime Minister of New Avalon within a week of the accidental death of his uncle, Prime Minister Martin DuVall.

newsItem.headline: Poznan Mired in civil war
newsItem.desc: A civil war has started on the planet Poznan between Polish and Spanish settlers over Palma Continent. Information from reporters on-site tell of scuffles ranging from name-calling and references to parental figures to full-fledged brawls.

newsItem.headline: Novais Motors announce Estevez Main Battle Tank
newsItem.desc: The Estevez, named after a militia officer on New Avalon, where it was constructed, will serve as the Federated Suns' primary battle tank for the duration of the twenty-fourth century. It is being lauded as one of the first and most successful tank designs created outside of the Terran Hegemony. The Estevez will make lighter-armed adversaries flee and break with its sheer size and might, and it will undoubtedly gain a fearsome reputation in the years to come.

newsItem.headline: Shiro Kurita orders the invasions of Benjamin, Asgard, and Telos IV
newsItem.desc: The worlds of Benjamin, Asgard, and Telos IV rebuked the rule of Shiro Kurita, resenting his methods for unification. In response, Shiro and his brother Urizen Kurita ordered their invasions. This comes after a sudden quelling of public dissent earlier in the month. Shiro continues to spout his view of cooperation between all the worlds under his leadership.

newsItem.headline: Alliance of Galedon reconquers the breakaway world of Telos IV
newsItem.desc: Telos Militia couldn't hold off Galedon troops for long. After intense initial fighting, Galedon forces swarmed into Telos' capital, capturing the final bastion of resistance held by the defenders of Telos and slaughtering those who managed to escape the artillery and tank shelling.

newsItem.headline: The planet Asgard returns to the fold of Shiro Kurita
newsItem.desc: Galledon forces quickly dispatched Asgard's air power. After brutal fighting, the world once again flies the Alliance flag.

newsItem.headline: Benjamin conquered by Galedon forces
newsItem.desc: The capital of Deber City fell to the invaders after dogged resistance by the defenders. Benjamin becomes the final of the rebellious worlds to fall back in line, under the iron rule of the Kuritas.

newsItem.headline: The Vulture-class Infantry Transport DropShip is first deployed by the Alliance of Galedon
newsItem.desc: Welcome to another episode of our military news holo-blog. The recent invasion of rebelling worlds by the Alliance of Galedon allowed us to have first view of the Vulture! The ship, a devoted troop transport designed for the Galedonian forces, stands-out for its excellent dependability and minimal maintenance. Because of the ship's modest size, the quarters are very small. I'm sure the troops don't look forward to travelling in it! The ship is designed to carry...

newsItem.headline: The Protectorate of Donegal is founded
newsItem.desc:
With help from his interstellar commerce company Donegal Freights and Goods to grease some wheels, Seth Marsden founded the Protectorate of Donegal. Surrounding the capital Donegal are many rich, but newly colonized worlds, giving the young nation plenty of potential.

Will it live up to it?

newsItem.headline: Civil War begins on Terra!
newsItem.desc: Grant Zoli, leader of PIP, was found dead early last month in his mansion. His death inflamed already escalating tensions between all parties in the government and violence escalated. In the last days of September, the Expansionist Party offices were attacked by the personal guards of the top Liberal Party official, who drove across Zurich and killed everyone inside. This event created a series of growing retaliations that show no sign of stopping.

newsItem.headline: Juliano Marik is appointed to his third term as Captain-General
newsItem.desc: Following the short, but disastrous rule of Danak Selaj, Juliano Marik returns to the highest office of the FWL to try and restore stability to the nation.

newsItem.headline: The Terran Alliance becomes the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc:
On June 2nd 2315, James McKenna brought the TAS Dreadnought into orbit above Terra, from where it destroyed two uninhabited islands, Strand Rock near Scotland and an island near Australia, using its Capital weaponry. After issuing an ultimatum, and a case for a Time for Change, James McKenna gained the favour of the Terran population.

This shook the combatants and after some residual fighting, McKenna issued the Hegemony Charter, ending the civil war and opening the door to the creation of the Terran Hegemony.

newsItem.headline: The Black Lion I-class battlecruiser enters service with the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc:
This battlecruiser class, the first WarShip to bear the name Black Lion, was developed to satisfy James McKenna's need for a more versatile and reasonably priced class of ships to support the Terran Hegemony's battleship fleet. The Dart light cruiser may have been serving in this capacity before, but the Black Lion is heavier and will establish the fundamental characteristics of a Hegemony battlecruiser.

Rumours that McKenna personally designed the Black Lion are most likely exaggerated.

newsItem.headline: James McKenna is elected Director-General of the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc: James McKenna was elected by the people of Terra as the Hegemony's Director-General and Lord Protector. The election, which was conducted with paper ballots by the citizens of the now-defunct Alliance, demonstrated that the populace was tired of the Alliance's bureaucracy and desired a different, more direct rule. The First meeting of the Hegemony Congress is to take place later in the year.

newsItem.headline: The Federated Suns is formed by the signatories of the Crucis Pact
newsItem.desc:
Twenty worlds within the Crucis Reach signed a treaty agreeing to form a mutual defense and trade union known as the Federated Suns. The architect of the Pact was Lucien Davion, who became first President of the Federated Suns.

In his own words:

Our one world cannot stand alone any longer; we must reach out, forge new bonds, and seek friends among the stars, so that our children can stay strong and free.

newsItem.headline: The Bonaventure-class WarShip is enters service with the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc: The Bonaventure-class is among today's top modern navy ships. The class boasts one of the most advanced sensor suites ever created. The Bonaventure is not very strongly armed, though, as compared to most other ships.

newsItem.headline: The Muskegon Empire joins the Federated Suns
newsItem.desc: The Muskegon Coalition, notable for being the first non–Terran interstellar nation formed, formally joined the Federated Suns. Two of its worlds, Emerson and Beten Kaitos, decided to join Chesterton Trade League instead. The Federated Suns demands that the worlds follow through with their leading world fell in deaf ears and the Suns are now poised to be thrown into their first interstellar conflict.

newsItem.headline: Enter the Draconis Combine
newsItem.desc: Shiro Kurita and Warlord Urizen Kurita's forceful campaign for the Alliance of Galedon had them rule an empire stretching from Terra to the Draconis Rift. Shiro has now rechristened his nation the Draconis Combine, becoming the first Coordinator of Worlds. He has vowed to Always preserve the dragon.

newsItem.headline: Spaniards rule in Poznan
newsItem.desc: Poznan Civil War has ended, with the Spanish side of the fight getting the spoils. This led to the establishment of a long-lasting, Spanish-influenced planetary government. They were offered and accepted membership into the Duchy of Liao.

newsItem.headline: Is freedom on the horizon for Capella?
newsItem.desc: Director-General McKenna's Second Campaign of Persuasion has hit a snag in the world of Capella. Free Capella, an organization of Capellan citizens and soldiers aiming to restore the planet's freedom, has been engaging in a guerrilla fight against Terran Hegemony rule. Military experts believe the resistance will fade over time as Hegemony troops keep their presence on planet.

newsItem.headline: The Vigilant-class WarShip is introduced into service by the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc: The Vigilant is a corvette intended for reconnaissance and surveillance that was developed shortly after the Bonaventure-class corvette. The Vigilant is a tiny military JumpShip, actually extremely small. The Vigilant is well-armed for its size, with three White Shark missile systems and five small naval autocannons. The ship is also equipped with PPCs, autocannons, and lasers. It has little armor though, and it accelerates very poorly.

newsItem.headline: The Spot Welder is introduced
newsItem.desc: Construction tools like the Spot Welder are frequently utilized on industrial robots. This contemporary rendition of the Spot Welder draws energy from the engine of the unit carrying it rather than its own batteries, as was typical in pre-spaceflight variants.

newsItem.headline: President Lucien Davion gets a bloody nose
newsItem.desc: After 4 years of fighting and after changing hands several times, the worlds of Emerson and Beten Kaitos are firmly in the grip of the Chesterton Trade Federation. Political opponents were quick to criticize Lucien Davion for his ineffective military command and coordination, which allowed the soldiers of the Tikonov Grand Union and Chesterton Trade Federation to easily defeat the Federated Suns army.

newsItem.headline: Apostle and Reaper Self-Propelled Artillery are first produced
newsItem.desc: The Apostle and its smaller sibling, the Reaper, were developed as two self-propelled artillery vehicles to replace dated and obsolete equipment once used by the Terran Alliance as part of the efforts made by Terran Hegemony Commanding General Field Marshal Mears Coblitz to modernize the Hegemony's Artillery Corps.

newsItem.headline: The Free Worlds League starts production of the Eagle Aerospace Fighter
newsItem.desc:
One of the first heavy aerospace fighters ever produced, the FWL proudly unveiled the Eagle as a heavy aerospace superiority fighter. It is a sturdy fighter that weighs 75 tons, and the design of the craft is simple so that the airframe may be used consistently for many decades.

The Eagle, designed for missions far from known supply routes, has a variety of lasers, and due to substantial amount of heat sinks it carries, the fighter can fire the majority of these weapons almost continuously.

newsItem.headline: Novaya Zemlya votes to join the Federated Suns
newsItem.desc: Settled by ethnic Russians from Terra, Novaya Zemlya formed close ties to the St. Ives Mercantile Association, Crucis Pact, and Tikonov Grand Union. The tough locals made the decision to join the Federated Suns but kept close contact with their traditional trading partners in St. Ives and Tikonov.

newsItem.headline: The Cruiser-class WarShip is first produced by the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc:
The origins of the Cruiser lay a century earlier than today, during the reign of the Terran Alliance and the fears the Alliance had that its rule would be challenged by separatist colonies. Legends amongst those slated to crew the Cruiser argue that it has been named by a committee led by Captain Hobb V. Ess.

Regardless of the Cruiser's original history, Director-General James McKenna concluded that the designs produced by the Alliance will be adequate for his objective of reuniting now-independent planets with Terra.

newsItem.headline: The Vendetta Medium Fighter enters service in the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc: The Terran Hegemony's air force deploys the Vendetta Medium Fighter, a ground assault and air superiority fighter. The Vendetta, equipped with a variety of the strongest energy weaponry available to the Hegemony Armed Forces, represents a significant improvement above the fairly subpar designs with which it will serve. The Hegemony boasts that the Vendetta is the most powerful aircraft in service with the HAF, and we are inclined to believe it.

newsItem.headline: The Dragon is hungry...
newsItem.desc: Coordinator Shiro Kurita has set his sights on the Principality of Rasalhague, a mostly peaceful but densely populated nation, and sent in his invading hordes. Sensing an easy prey, the Coordinator hopes to bring the ill-fated nation into the Dragon's way.

newsItem.headline: The Gunji-no-Kanrei of the Draconis Combine Urizen Kurita, dies
newsItem.desc: Urizen Kurita, brother of Coordinator Shiro Kurita, died from congestive heart failure. He is survived by the youngest of his 3 children, Adam Kurita. Seen by some as a great Warlord and by others as a ruthless butcher, he will not see the fruits of the Combine's attempt to conquer the Principality of Rasalhague.

newsItem.headline: Director-General McKenna has Fallen
newsItem.desc: Director-General McKenna passed away from cancer yesterday, surrounded by the family he loved so dearly. We at TNS join the entire Hegemony in mourning the loss of a great man, and wishing his family well through the difficult days ahead.

newsItem.headline: A gathering of merchants
newsItem.desc:
At an invitation from Kevin Tamar of the Tamar Pact, Simon Marsden (leader of of the Protectorate of Donegal) and Thomas McQuiston (ruler of the Federation of Skye), have joined in a summit to discuss shared goals and common threats. It is expected that the stealthy growth of the Rim Worlds Republic, the recent clashes with Terran forces and a free trade agreement are all on the table.

There have been talks of a full merger by the three mercantile powers, but so far all the leaders have kept mum about it.

newsItem.headline: Michael Cameron is elected Director-General of the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc: Michael Cameron, third cousin of the late James McKenna, was elected to lead the Terran Hegemony in these troubled times. James final and humbling public address barely managed to keep the Konrad McKenna's debacle at bay. With believers and detractors of McKenna's vision making themselves heard, it's up to the calm, bright Michael to set the path for the future of the Hegemony.

newsItem.headline: Reynard Davion is sworn into office today
newsItem.desc:
My family has served you since the very beginning, and it will continue to serve as long as this august body is willing to accept or aid. I am not my father; I do not have his record of achievements to prove my worth to you. What I can offer to you is my heart, my soul, my flesh, and my untiring devotion, not only to my own world, but to any world that seeks the protection and the freedom of these Federated Suns.

— Reynard Davion acceptance speech for President of the Federated Suns.

newsItem.headline: The Lyran Commonwealth is founded
newsItem.desc:
The nations of the Tamar Pact, Protectorate of Donegal and Federation of Skye have merged. Already close trade partners, recent threats to their respective realms pushed their leaders into a new coalition. Apparently, it was the fashion of government that delayed the agreement, with the merchant nations finally reaching a consensus of modelling it after the ancient Greek city-states. There will be 9 Archons, with one being an Archon Basileus, the defacto leader.

The founders are hopeful that their strong economies together will bring prosperity to its citizens.

newsItem.headline: Adam Kurita is named Warlord of Rasalhague
newsItem.desc: Following the return home of Tenno Kurita, the prospective next Coordinator, Adam Kurita, son of former Warlord Urizen, is the new Warlord of the region of Rasalhague, which is currently fighting off the Draconis Combine invasion with mixed success. Raging for 12 years already, it is not yet possible for us to ascertain when it will end or what the result might be.

newsItem.headline: Slow burn revenge?
newsItem.desc: The Federated Suns president, Reynard Davion, apparently knows how to keep a grudge. Decades after the Suns' defeat against Tikonov Grand Union, they are back to exact compensation, in the form of the planet Almach. The newly minted task force from the Federated Suns, commanded by the president himself, made short work of Tikonov Forces stationed there. They then made the trip to both Conway and Mira, in a bid to turn the colours of both worlds.

newsItem.headline: The gamble of HRAD
newsItem.desc: Michael Cameron's rule has been a quiet one so far, but that looks like it's about to change. It has just been announced the creation of the Hegemony Research Alliance Department (HRAD). This centralized think-tank has the goal to agglomerate all the non-military research, improving efficiency and output. Many scholars are crying foul at the mostly certain abandonment of any peripheral research elsewhere in the Hegemony, but are helpless to stop the restructuring. Whether this change will pay off, only the future will tell.

newsItem.headline: Almach Accords signed
newsItem.desc: Reynard Davion demonstrated plenty of diplomatic and military aplomb during the recent Federated Suns-Tikonov Grand Union aggression. By preemptively signing the Acala Pact with the Capellan Commonality, he effectively locked them out of the conflict, opening the way to the Almach Accords now signed. Almach, Conway and Mira all exchanged hands, further bolstering Richard Davion's nation.

newsItem.headline: Lola I-class Destroyer enters service for the Hegemony
newsItem.desc: The Lola-class destroyer was created as an escort and picket vessel. Due to mounting substantial armor, the Lola was more hefty than expected and needed Rolls Le Fay interplanetary drives to fulfill performance standards. This is the only drawback of the Lola. Because space within the Lola's shell is at a premium, designers were forced to decrease internal room for other systems. As a result, this ship is extremely crowded. The Lola isn't intended to be a transport ship. The class only has three bays, which it uses to transport two small crafts and roughly 115,000 tons of cargo along with one squadron of aerospace fighters.

newsItem.headline: Morrison-O'Connor-Marquand Corporation begins production of Caravan Heavy Transport Aircraft prototypes
newsItem.desc: Orders for the Caravan Heavy Transport are coming from a variety of planetary civilian and governmental entities, making it a well-liked large support aircraft. The Caravan, created by Phillip Farnsworth, fills an inexpensive link in the global transportation system that cannot be served by the more expensive DropShips or operational space shuttles. The Morrison-O'Connor-Marquand Corporation is hoping that the Caravan will be a huge success and provide funds for it to expand its production facilities to other planets.

newsItem.headline: The first Coordinator, Shiro Kurita, dies
newsItem.desc:
Beloved Shiro Kurita, Lord of Yamashiro, First Citizen of New Samarkand, Director of the Alliance of Galedon and first Coordinator of the Draconis Combine, died, but the Dragon lives on.

Always preserve the dragon and its magic will keep you strong. - Shiro Kurita
His son Tenno Kurita, is now the Coordinator, embodying all that is the Combine.

newsItem.headline: Quixote-class Frigate revealed by Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc: Originally intended to be a battlecruiser, the Quixote-class was trimmed to a frigate size as a result of cost-cutting measures, and the ship was given engines that were too small for it. To make the best of a poor situation it was converted into a missile frigate. This resulted in the creation of a slow but heavily armed vessel that was charged with protecting convoys from boats too small to be hit by direct-fire naval weaponry.

newsItem.headline: Back to medieval times?
newsItem.desc:
Lord Protector Michael Cameron certainly made waves today by announcing the Edict of 2351. With it, the Director-General aims to revive the nobility system, granting classical noble titles and also modernized ones. For those worried about the possible abuse of the system, his speech holds the answer:

No, the reason I have introduced the concept of nobility is to reward people who have done more than what was expected of them, and have thus advanced all mankind's fortunes. It is a reward for action, not attributes.

newsItem.headline: The Peer List is revealed
newsItem.desc: Director-General Michael Cameron read his Peer List - creating the first Nobles of the Terran Hegemony - which included names as Yumiko Sakuma (a famed novelist, and a favourite of the Lord Protector), and Professor Gregory Atlas, head of a project at the University of Zimbabwe. No members of the government were on the list, assuaging some concerns about the nature and future of these titles.

newsItem.headline: Essex I-class destroyer makes maiden flight
newsItem.desc: The distinction of being the first notable destroyer class to enter service with the Terran Hegemony belongs to the Essex-class destroyer. The Lola-class destroyer and the Essex will be the most abundant units among the Hegemony's first generation of WarShips thanks to the planned production run lasting for three decades. The Essex uses a combination of naval autocannon and naval lasers for weapons and is capable of acceleration at speeds of up to two and a half Gs. Each ship is protected by 330 tons of conventional armor.

newsItem.headline: Going in for the kill
newsItem.desc: After several wars with disastrous effects that saw Tikonov Grand Union bleeding planets to its close neighbours on all fronts, and plagued by riots on many population centers, the nation looks like a sitting duck. Trying to capitalize on the weakened Tikonov position, the Sarna Supremacy eagerly opened the warfare gates.

newsItem.headline: A lasting peace?
newsItem.desc: The brutal war waged by the Sarna Supremacy over Tikonov Grand Union came to a halt after 2 years, with Capellan Prime Minister Sarah Palmer negotiating a fragile peace by proxy, using the neutral St. Ives merchant faction as a stage for talks.

newsItem.headline: The Eagle soars into the pockets of the Free Worlds League
newsItem.desc: After years of lengthy and heated debates, Parliament adopted its own legal tender this year, the M-Bill or Eagle, backed by Germanium. Provinces will still maintain the right to print their own currency. In other economic news, Arcadia Mining Corporation has discovered a massive lode of germanium in the Irian system and pledged it to the federal government as part of a very lucrative deal. A company spokesperson declared this action will...

newsItem.headline: Edasich Aerospace Corporation starts the first deliveries of the Colt
newsItem.desc:
The Colt is a conventional fighter of medium size that is intended for both air and ground support. The fighter was designed to act as both a fighter and an assault aircraft. Its affordability will undoubtedly contribute to its popularity. It's covered in 1.5 tons of armor equivalent to BAR-5 Grade commercial civilian armor. The craft's range is not very long because it only has 3.5 tons of fuel. The only weaponry carried by the Colt are its wing-mounted 5-Tubed Long-Range Missile Launchers.

Starting this year, Edasich Aerospace is willing to sell the Colt to several planetary militias and private security companies in the Commonwealth.

newsItem.headline: Harrow-Deerfield Heavy Industrial Works announces the Lumberjack is ready for its first tests starting this year
newsItem.desc: The Lumberjack is a heavy version of the newly developed WorkMech. This WorkMech was created by Tamar's Harrow-Deerfield Heavy Industrial Works as a standalone logging operations vehicle. For the corporation, which previously produced more conventional construction, mining, and logging vehicles, the ForestryMech is the first vehicle of its kind. The Deerfield-690 Chainsaw, which is placed in place of the Lumberjack's right hand actuator, is its primary tool. It has a lift hoist on its left arm to assist with hauling logs and other loads for its work. The WorkMech has an 8-ton load capacity dumper.
newsItem.service: Business and Tech in the Commonwealth

newsItem.headline: Franco Martell Liao is instated as the next Duke of the Duchy of Liao
newsItem.desc: After the death of his father, the responsibility of managing the transport powerhouse of the Duchy falls on the young Franco Liao. At 12 years old, he inherits a small, but thriving nation built by his father. The Duchy brushed aside requests by this publication for an exclusive interview citing The new Duke's young age, and the trying times of the moment.

newsItem.headline: The Federated Peacekeeping Forces are on the move
newsItem.desc: Reports of a large contingency of the Federated Peacekeeping Forces arriving on Bell have spilled out of the system. It appears that the occupation is meant as a show of force, holding the world hostage, allowing President Reynard Davion to also demand the worlds of Chesterton and Highspire. The Sarna Supremacy has for the moment grudgingly accepted the demands. Even so, the Capellan Commonality, Sarna Supremacy and Tikonov Grand Union have vowed to counter this aggression and disrespect for the Acala Pact, but it's unclear at the moment when or how will that happen.

newsItem.headline: Julian Dux resigns as Prime Minister of the Capellan Commonality
newsItem.desc: The rule of Julian Dux rotted quickly. After the recent loss of worlds to the Federated Suns, the response by Capella and its allies - widely regarded as too late - finding an empty planet at Bell amongst the previously taken worlds, has made the government collapse, forcing Julian's exit. In his stead, Seluk Tucas vows to bring the Commonality back on track.

newsItem.headline: Who took the Bellites? Aliens!
newsItem.desc: Now, before you thrash this theory, just hear me out: The Capellan forces reaching Bell found no trace of the Bell's colonists, or the invading Suns' forces, just empty everything. Reynard's government never gave any explanation for it. And now I'm hearing word of Bellites suddenly appearing on the fringes of Federated Suns' territory? Deep into the periphery? Out of thin air? It can only have been aliens, there's no other explanation! I have a diagram here somewhere that explains all of this...

newsItem.headline: Sheinhardt Universal Technologies shuts down
newsItem.desc: Plagued by issues almost from its inception, Sheinhardt offices were closed after one too many scandals. The news of its subsidiaries selling sub-par, slightly modified equipment to players outside the Hegemony spelled the final doom to the embattled company. The Asher Missile Platform, already an aging weapons system, will cease production and be phased out of the HAF forces, a spokesperson has said.

newsItem.headline: The Federated Suns enters the Big League!
newsItem.desc: The new Defender Class Battlecruiser, the first operational WarShip design for the Federated Suns, will be the subject of this Holo-Vid. The Defender is constructed to have greater speed and firepower than the Dreadnought-Class Battleships of the newly founded Terran Hegemony. They can outrun and outmaneuver the early Black Lion Battlecruisers as well as the Dreadnoughts of the Terran Hegemony because to their rapid rate of acceleration. The Class 35 and 20 Naval Autocannons that are placed in the ship's forward sections and broadsides make up the Defender's primary armament. The ship has a substantial number of Class-5 Autocannons installed in weapons bays throughout, as well as a sizable number of Machine Guns that are used for point defense.

newsItem.headline: Etien Davion welcomes two baby boys!
newsItem.desc: Recently married to the lovely Marion Michaels, Etien Davion announced the birth of his twin sons, Edmund and Edward. Everyone at New Avalon Press wish upon the couple all the luck controlling the tiny ones!

newsItem.headline: Clan Stuart announces it is open for business
newsItem.desc: Clan Stuart just formed the mercenary group The Northwind Highlanders with the creation of the First Kearny Highlanders. The independent mercenaries are based off the amiable planet Northwind, which is now their Homeworld. The Scottish pride, strength and tradition will certainly serve them well.

newsItem.headline: The Capellan Commonality-Federated Suns border is once again aflame
newsItem.desc: Severely threatened by the recent moves by the Federated Suns' forces, Seluk Tucas recalled his ambassador brother from New Avalon. His mysterious disappearance during travel spawned a need to respond. Amassing a large strike force with the help of the Tikonov Grand Union and the St. Ives Mercantile League, the Capellans attacked the once Capellan world of Lee. The reports of a massive rout by the attacking forces are not exaggerated, with most of the purported liberators destroyed. Calls for Tucas removal are already multiplying.

newsItem.headline: Geraldine Marik is assassinated
newsItem.desc: Two months after the assassination attempt that left Geraldine Marik's son Allan injured, the Captain-General was found dead earlier today in her personal quarters. While details are scarce, authorities have assured the culprit will be brought to justice and the facilitators of both attempts will be uncovered. Mikhail, brother of Geraldine Marik, has come forward in a bid to rule as regent while his nephew recovers from his injuries.

newsItem.headline: Northwind Highlanders grow once again
newsItem.desc: Early success by the mercenary command of the Highlanders has led to the creations of the 2nd Kearny Highlanders last year and the 3rd Kearny Highlanders this year. The future looks bright for the skilled sell-swords.

newsItem.headline: The Capellan nations unite
newsItem.desc: After a very tense discussion between the leaders of all the factions in the Capellan region, an almost unanimous vote has put Duke Franco Liao of the Duchy of Liao as the leader of the newly formed Capellan Confederation. Even with the much larger threats surrounding them, what pushed the various rulers to unity was an impassioned, yet dangerous speech by the Duke's wife Caroline Tucas that involved a ceremonial sword. The vote is still to be ratified over the next 400 days, but the Duke-turned-Chancellor of the Capellan nation can already bring to bear its military to fend off yet another incursion by the Federated Suns into its territory.

newsItem.headline: The Capellan resolve
newsItem.desc:
Reynard Davion and the Federated Suns have gotten a taste of the mettle of Chancellor Liao's Confederation. Having occupied Capella with his Federated Peacekeeping Forces under the pretense of giving stability to the Capellan region during the leadership crisis (which, some observers would point out, was of his own doing), Reynard Davion was not expecting an empty Capella Prime waiting for his forces.

The brutal orbital bombardment that followed and subsequent decimation of several Davion units along with thousands of Capellan civilians showed the lengths the nation was willing to go to thwart invaders. The capital will be relocated to Sian, and the Chancellor has vowed to memorialize the civilians sacrifice in our very flag, if need be.

newsItem.headline: Is the Draconis Combine sated?
newsItem.desc: As the Principality of Rasalhague invasion war comes to a close, the question that burns in the mind of any outside observer is: was it worth it? Tenno declared victory in the war against Rasalhague, but the reality is not that simple. Although the Principality had been defeated, and acknowledged the Combine as their overlords, in reality the Rasalhagians largely maintained their independence, and their culture remains strongly embedded. How will the Dragon impose its doctrine and will the Rasalhagians accept it?

newsItem.headline: Director-General Michael Cameron to retire
newsItem.desc: After 27 years at the helm of the Terran Hegemony, Michael Cameron is stepping down. His rule was of a quiet reform that saw the birth of an increasingly efficient government bureaucracy and improved research output. His only surviving child and HAF Navy veteran Margaret will follow his foot-steps as she is elected the new Director-General.

newsItem.headline: Mikhail Marik tenure as Captain-General of the Free Worlds League ends with his passing
newsItem.desc: Mikhail's rule ended unexpectedly as he is found dead by his own hand. Rumours of illness and close family deaths are pointed as possible reasons for this tragic ending to his term. Allan Marik had nothing to say when pressed for comments.

newsItem.headline: First Strike Falcon VTOL prototypes are unveiled
newsItem.desc: Among the first Attack VTOLs to join service in the newly established Capellan Confederation is the Strike Falcon. The vessel was created to replace the OT-12 Bird of Prey attack helicopter, which was originally used by the defunct Tikonov Grand Union. It will go into service in 2371 and provide Confederation ground forces with fire support and infantry transport. Its main payload can accommodate 6 tons of soldiers.

newsItem.headline: Capellan state stops a tumult on New Hessen
newsItem.desc: A Capellan Defense Force official has announced that an operation to stop a riot on the planet of New Hessen has been successful. A rogue force led by disgraced Tikonov noble Baron TChigorin attempted to seize a supply depot. A quick and effective response by Capellan forces allowed for the depot to be liberated with minimal losses. The few surviving traitors will be swiftly brought to justice.

newsItem.headline: The Federated Suns declares their operation in the Tikonov nation finished
newsItem.desc: The Federated Suns, after more than 20 years of peacekeeping activities in the Tikonov/Capellan region, have asserted that their population is safe once again and are dialling back their activities. Officials have said they are content that the Capellan political strife is in the past, but they will keep a friendly eye on the bordering planets.

newsItem.headline: The hidden nation
newsItem.desc: When Davion forces struck what they thought to be a Liao base in Robsart, they didn't realize that they had, in fact, uncovered a previously hidden faction at the edges of colonized space. After an altercation with a capable enemy navy, Reynard Davion vowed to not let the slight by an organized band of pirates go unpunished. The nation in question, the Taurian Concordat, remained hidden for years. Join us next for a round table on how could that happen, and who is Richard Calderon, their leader.

newsItem.headline: The Monsoon-class battleship starts production
newsItem.desc: The Monsoon-class battleship is built to dominate the void and serve as a model for all succeeding ships by utilising the tactical and technological advancements made possible by the initial WarShips, such as the TAS Dreadnought. The Monsoon is a monster, fully armed with naval-grade armament. Three bays and six DropShip collars are on the large ship. A wing of six fighters, eight small craft, and almost 300,000 tons of cargo may all be transported in these bays.

newsItem.headline: SelaSys Incorporated introduces the League class destroyer
newsItem.desc: The League-class destroyer is the first WarShip that the Free Worlds League has designed and produced domestically. The final assembly is completed at the SelaSys Incorporated shipyards in the Loyalty system using components produced throughout the FWL. New and legacy technologies are balanced in the League's design. There are still two DropShuttle Bays, allowing older and smaller DropShuttles to dock with a League, as holdovers from the former period of space travel. Fortunately, engineers were also able to incorporate more recent inventions that improve the protection of the ship and the craft it carries, such as a DropShip collar and the presence of a Fighter Bay.

newsItem.headline: Short Range Missile Launchers begin mass production at the Terran Hegemony
newsItem.desc:
Short-Range Missiles, which were first designed in 2365, are direct-fire missiles that forego range in favour of greater damage potential.

What makes these self-guided missiles distinctive is that they use a specific armor-piercing explosive warhead. The discovery of a metal composite/high explosive mixture has made it possible for the warhead to be completely made of high-explosive material, including the missile's frame. As a result, more missiles may be transported and fired while still having warheads with the same level of destructive power as older models that were four times as long.

SRMs are more efficient against infantry and combat vehicles than LRMs despite being less sophisticated.

newsItem.headline: Etien Davion is the new President of the Federated Suns
newsItem.desc: A month after his father died from another struggle with Black Marsh Fever, Etien Davion is sworn in as the new President of the Suns, having already been voted in as the Prime Minister of New Avalon earlier. Having served in the Federated Peacekeeping Forces, he is a natural and unquestioned choice for the position.

newsItem.headline: A border secured?
newsItem.desc: Just as news arrive of the death of Reynard Davion, the fighting along the Federated Suns-Taurian Concordat border diminished to a halt. There are reports that although Davion forces attention is being redirected to other threats, like the Capellan Confederation, the still mostly unknown Taurian nation is keeping a healthy military presence on worlds near the Federated Suns.

newsItem.headline: For all our technology, space is still a dangerous proposition
newsItem.desc: Space travel has become ubiquitous in our lives, and almost as normal as a pan-continental trip. But we must not forget that spaceships are extremely complex objects, with many moving parts, and that any travel through the void of space hinges on many calculations and procedures, the failure of a single one begetting catastrophe. Case in point: the recent disappearance of a jumpship with thousands of souls aboard. Our prayers go out to them, hoping they found peace in the emptiness of space...

newsItem.headline: Aegis class heavy cruiser is introduced
newsItem.desc: Di Tron Heavy Industries' diligent work resulted in the THS Aegis, the first ship of the Aegis-class heavy cruisers, which is intended to serve the Terran Hegemony for centuries. The Aegis is one of the most advanced designs available right now, with several cutting-edge elements like detachable jump sails, and it offers exceptional firepower and mobility.

newsItem.headline: The Scotts shame the Dragon
newsItem.desc: After a rocky beginning with mixed results while employed by the Capellan Confederation against House Marik, the Highlanders have met undoubted success on the Capellan-Combine border, with a recent daring raid on Rio netting them an officer from the Kurita's forces. The Draconis Combine has said to be vexed by the affront and it is sure to retaliate.

newsItem.headline: Commonwealth's Navy grows into its wings
newsItem.desc:
The Commonwealth is the first WarShip made in the Lyran Commonwealth, however it may not have been as locally constructed as previously thought.

Di Tron Heavy Industries, situated in Terra, acquired the interest of the Lyrans around 2371. They possessed the necessary skills and experience, while the Lyran Commonwealth was well-versed in financial deceit. After two months of financial ruse on the part of the Lyrans, a new business, Ioto Galactic Enterprises, was established to get around the legality of the limitations the Terran Hegemony placed on the sale of certain technologies by Di Tron.The first Commonwealth-class light cruisers are launched from the Port Sydney Naval Yards three years later.

The announcement of a Colt Medium Fighter SRM variant also being produced show that the Commonwealth made the decision to bolster its Navy, a move lauded by many military scholars throughout Lyran space.

newsItem.headline: An Archon Basileus, at last?
newsItem.desc: After years of economic and political strife, with several of the Archons vying for power within the still leaderless Commonwealth, many separatist movements threatened the existence of the Lyran nation itself. Robert Marsden, tired of these delays, decided to take action. After another fruitless meeting with the Archons, Robert publicly revealed verifiable information showing the corruption of almost every single one of them. The public was outraged and supported Robert's move to declare himself the Archon Basileus of a newly formed government.

newsItem.headline: Terrorist attack endangers Kurita bloodline
newsItem.desc: Warlord of Rasalhague Vladimir Kurita and almost all of his children - including 6 month old Iteki Kurita - have been reported dead after a brutal terrorist attack. Rasalhagian rebels have already claimed being the authors of the massacre that also took the life of Oma Kurita, daughter of the first Coordinator himself. The reaction of Jason Kurita, Vladimir's oldest son, currently at the capital, is not yet know.

newsItem.headline: Indeed, an Archon Basileus, at last
newsItem.desc: Robert Marsden is elected the first Archon Basileus of the Lyran Commonwealth by the assembled Estates General. Hopefully, this will end the instability plaguing the nation.

newsItem.headline: Coordinator Nihongi Kurita now carries the will of the Dragon
newsItem.desc: Nihongi Kurita is now the Coordinator of the Draconis Combine, after the honorable suicide of his father. Plagued by the shame of the failure of protecting his younger sister Omi, the arrival of her body to the capital triggered Tenno into the act. Nihongi has said he is happy the honor of the family has been saved and eagerly accepted the responsibility of leadership.

newsItem.headline: President Etien Davion divorces Marion
newsItem.desc: Etien's presidential tenure has been marred by scandals and problems almost from its inception. Etien's grinding personality and lack of charisma has created a harsh climate for governance. And now, a new issue to add to the pile: with the divorce, one of the reportedly last controlling forces in Etien's circle vanishes, promising to further destabilize this presidency.

newsItem.headline: The Dragon rejoices with the safe return of Oma Kurita
newsItem.desc: After years with her fate unknown, and presumed dead, Oma Kurita returns to the safety of her home. After learning the true fate and location of his grand-niece, Adam Kurita personally lead the operation that lead to her rescue. Everyone involved in her disappearance has been killed, according to Combine officials.

newsItem.headline: Etien Davion dies by suicide
newsItem.desc: The last few years had been hard on President Etien, but even more so on the Federated Suns. The lack of will to make any decision, the pursuit of every pleasure and every whim, the sheer insanity of the man, brought the nation to a stand-still, with many worlds doubting the government's long term viability. An assassination attempt (the second one that is known) by an old childhood friend of Etien's was apparently, the final straw. Perhaps gaining a glimpse of clarity, the former President took his own life, leaving the personal bodyguards stunned. With his twin sons still very young, and his sister too inexperienced, the best candidate for the succession appears to be his 38 year old brother, Paul Davion.

newsItem.headline: Earthworks Incorporated branch is created in Tikonov
newsItem.desc: Earthworks Inc. first found great success developing one of the first prototype mining robots, which was also one of the first Workmechs. Expanding rapidly into various sorts of robots and vehicles, it now has the ability to directly supply the Capellan nation with military hardware.

newsItem.headline: Capellan Confederation strengthens its Navy with Du Shi Wang
newsItem.desc: The Du Shi Wang is the first legitimate WarShip that was developed by the newly formed Capellan Confederation in 2380 but was designed earlier by the Duchy of Liao. Its purpose is to anchor the enormous armed merchant ships that the Duchy of Liao owns. As a result, the ship will likely be accompanied by a large number of support vessels to mitigate any design flaws and reinforce its advantages. Standard tactics will presumably be to simply point the battleship towards the greatest target and batter it until it is destroyed. This is partly due to a lack of resources to incorporate the large broadside weaponry common to other battleships.

newsItem.headline: Terran Hegemony tightens technology control
newsItem.desc: Building upon Michael Cameron's policies to centralize and protect local research, Michael's daughter Lady Margaret has set extra rules and definitions by creating an Official List of Sensitive and Secret Technologies. These will increase the control the Hegemony has on leaked knowledge and keep a decisive edge to Earth-born tech, but detractors fear stifled development and a bogged down economy.

newsItem.headline: Terra mourns the passing of Michael Cameron
newsItem.desc: Michael Cameron, former Director-General died at 71. A calm and bright man, his last years were spent in quiet retirement. His only daughter and current Director-General Margaret, will be speaking at the funeral.

newsItem.headline: Lady Margaret announces her retirement
newsItem.desc: Director-General and Lady Protector Margaret Cameron is retiring. In a speech, she mentioned her diagnose of cervical cancer 2 years earlier and that despite fighting it into remission, she no longer feels capable of continuing in the Director-General's position. She put forward the name of her first-born Raymond to be voted as the next leader. A former pilot whose military career ended after an accident, it will be left to the people whether he's the right man to lead the Hegemony.

newsItem.headline: Tense negotiations at the Terran-FedSuns border
newsItem.desc: After a brief confrontation between the Federated Peacekeeping Forces and Hegemony Armed Forces over trading rights, President Paul Davion sent his sister, Marie Davion as his deputy to negotiate an end to hostilities. Initial reporting shows promising results, with Marie being commended by her diplomatic skills.

newsItem.headline: Merkava Heavy Tank Mk II announce by HAF officials
newsItem.desc: Set to start full production this year, the Merkava Mk II is the new iteration of the original Merkava Heavy Tank. Produced by Leopard Armor of Terra, it is to be deployed as a front line battle tank, like its predecessor.

newsItem.headline: Allan Marik starts his second term as Captain-General of the Free Worlds League
newsItem.desc: Called to service the League once more, Allan Marik is now the Captain-General, in a bid to deal with the Capellan border, on which skirmishes have been escalating, and some worlds have seen disputed ownership over the last few years.

newsItem.headline: The world of Bryant IV loses face-off with Director-General
newsItem.desc: Bryant habitants have long been vocal against Raymond Cameron mother's Military Recruitment and Preparedness Bill. They resented the mandatory enlistment and voted this year to force the Director-General to alter the law. Cameron responded with a heavy hand by cutting off all funds and threatening a military operation on the planet. The people of Bryant decided, perhaps wisely, to withdraw their demands against a seemingly more embattled Director-General. While this crisis is averted, the method used will only increase the bad-blood against Raymond amongst the Hegemony population.

newsItem.headline: Marie Davion becomes the official deputy of her brother, President Paul Davion
newsItem.desc: The recent success at defusing the tension with Hegemony government has led Paul Davion to change the previously temporary deputy position into a permanent one.

newsItem.headline: Taurian Concordat has a new leader
newsItem.desc: Although not as mysterious as when first encountered, the Concordat still remains a riddle for many, not least of which, the Federated Suns. The recently deceased Protector of the Realm, Richard Calderon saw his nation being exposed to the known universe, and it is still struggling to find its position. A position made difficult by the looming presence of the Davion-ruled nation. Daniel Calderon will now rule in his father's stead.

newsItem.headline: SCANDAL: Katherine McQuiston is PREGNANT!
newsItem.desc:
This year's final days have brought an INCREDIBLE story from the halls of the GOVERNMENT: Katherine McQuiston, famed Federation of Skye noble, and HEIR to McQuiston fortune, is with CHILD, and although that should be a joyous time, we're certain that's NOT the case for ruling Director-General Raymond, who is STERILE after an accident when he was younger. In fact, word is, he is MAD about this whole thing. And he's probably going to get even MADDER, because it's just been confirmed that the father is non-other than Raymond's BROTHER, Brian!

UNBELIEVABLE!

Be sure to also check our stories about the lives of Raymond, Brian and Katherine and ALL their DALLIANCES!

newsItem.headline: The Director-General has suffered a fatal heart attack
newsItem.desc:
Lord Protector Raymond Cameron has been confirmed dead from a heart attack brought by his medication. This comes after difficult days for the Director-General. After increased dissent from the public for months, he recently found his wife Katherine fathered a child with his own brother Brian. He had Brian arrested and accused of treason, for which Raymond wanted Brian put on trial for.

That didn't come to be. After a meeting with the High Council, Raymond collapsed in his quarters. The President of Terran Congress was sworn in Pro-tem, in an attempt to recover political stability. Brian remains incarcerated.

newsItem.headline: Brian Cameron elected Director-General
newsItem.desc: After a short incarceration period during which his son with Katherine McQuiston, Richard, was born, Brian Cameron was finally put on trial. The trial showed the general public the insane ramblings of the deteriorating mind of Raymond, and helped show his innocence of the treason charges imputed to him by his late brother. With his image somewhat saved in the public eye, a close win put him as the new Lord Protector of the Hegemony.

newsItem.headline: Just a mining operation?
newsItem.desc: The Snowden Class Mining Station design, by the Taurian Concordat, has been uncovered. The Concordat asserts that its purpose is to aid in the extraction of the region's mining wealth. The Snowden was created when hostilities with the Concordat's Davion neighbours are intensifying. Despite its intended civilian use as a mining station, the station was built with what appears to be a sizable amount of armor and weapons. Reports that the station contains spacecraft repair capabilities and a KF-Boom that enables the station to be mated to a JumpShip and transferred to a different solar system without being disassembled raise doubts about its true nature.

newsItem.headline: Taurian Concordat has its first regent
newsItem.desc: The untimely death of Daniel Calderon left her 3 year old daughter as a successor but unable to rule. Sigur Fonn was chosen as regent for the realm in a tense time for the region.

newsItem.headline: Terran Hegemony begins construction of fortresses throughout
newsItem.desc: Brian Cameron has ordered the increase of the budget for the military. The biggest slice of this will go to the construction of massive military installations in various planets in the border region of the Terran Hegemony, namely, the Hegemony-Combine border. The reason and location for these constructions are still not entirely known, but the Director-General's past as a House Kurita ambassador and the current events all over the Inner Sphere give the Terran citizens assurance regarding the decision.

newsItem.headline: Allan Marik dies in Dropship incident
newsItem.desc: Shortly after leaving the position of Captain-General for the third time, Allan Marik was travelling in a Dropship when it suffered an accident. His death is under heavy investigation taking into account the high tensions between our nation and the Capellan Confederation, so most details are being kept under secrecy. His son Peter will succeed his father in the Captain-Generalcy.

newsItem.headline: Paul Davion Presidency ends
newsItem.desc: The President of the Federated Suns, Paul Davion, died from an illness after several years of declining health. His sister Marie, once too inexperienced to take the role, has now become a proper and qualified candidate, and at 46 years of age has become the new President. This was not without some struggle. Marion Michaels-Davion, Marie's sister-in-law, has devised a deal where her own twin sons Edmund and Edward are now in the line of succession, along with Marie's nephew, Simon.

newsItem.headline: Archon Basileus Robert Marsden has passed away
newsItem.desc: Lyran officials have stated that the Archon was found dead in his room. They cite a heart attack as the reason for his demise, a very likely consequence of the stress plaguing the Lyran ruler as of late. The disastrous raid of the Promised Land system that resulted in the decimation of no less than ten troop regiments, pinned on Robert by the Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces High Command could surely have contributed to it.

newsItem.headline: How did Robert Marsden really die?
newsItem.desc: It is understandable that the government might want to keep the details of the Archon's death under wraps, but the details don't seem to add up. He was 44 years old, he was a fit freak, no history of illness. He was, on the other hand, at the receiving end of blistering criticism from High Command, being blamed - some would say unfairly - of the Promised Land disaster. The reaction of the department's dignitaries to a recent showing of Hamlet gives credit to another theory, one where the High Command is not as innocent as it seems...

newsItem.headline: Alistair Marsden is sworn in as second Archon of the Lyran Commonwealth
newsItem.desc: Alistair,the younger brother of the first Archon Basileus Robert Marsden will follow his brother footsteps. It appears he does so with some reluctance in leaving the Commonwealth's Tank Brigade, were he is a junior officer. His brother left the Commonwealth with a stronger military, but added borders disputes that now fall on Alistair's shoulders.

newsItem.headline: Chancellor Franco Liao to resign
newsItem.desc: Franco Liao, Chancellor, and Caroline Tucas, President of the House of Scions, have resigned from their respective posts. Chancellor Liao believes he has created the foundations of a strong and enduring nation and, as promised when winning the position, stepped down. His brother, Kurnath Liao was named and sworn in as Chancellor. The former Chancellor will retire to the planet Liao, once belonging to his very own Duchy.

newsItem.headline: Nihongi Kurita dies
newsItem.desc: Coordinator Nihongi Kurita, son of Tenno Kurita has died in an accident while horse-riding. His successor, Robert Kurita, although not sharing the love for horses of his father, does indeed share a love for the Draconis Combine, and is eager to lead it.

newsItem.headline: Peter Marik appointed for second term as Captain-General
newsItem.desc: After a brief term after his father's death, Peter Marik is once again called upon to lead the Free World League during another crisis. The Capellan Confederation, although pressed hard by the military, does not relent in harassing FWL border worlds. The new Captain-General has thus vowed to not return to his former position as an MP until the Andurien Question has been solved.

newsItem.headline: The first Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation dies
newsItem.desc:
Officials have announced to a mourning nation the passing of Franco Liao. In this moment of uncertainty, when other powers are vying to take what is ours by right, let us heed the words of our first leader:

In the strength of the state lies the safety of the people; from one to the other, and neither alone. This is what makes Capellans strong. This is what gives us strength, and balance where others have none. Yin and yang-man and nation. - Franco Liao

newsItem.headline: The Marsden Battle Tank enters service with the Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces
newsItem.desc: The Marsden Main Battle Tank, which bears former Archon Robert Marsden's name, is now in use by the Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces. It will serve as the Commonwealth's general workhorse MBT for many decades with great success, as it combines a tried-and-true, straightforward design with cutting-edge technology.

newsItem.headline: The Capellan Confederation probes the Taurian Concordat
newsItem.desc: There have been reports of probing raids by Capellan forces against border worlds of the Concordat. While many of these worlds don't appear to be full-fledged colonies, it is obvious that the Chancellor Kurnath Liao is coveting the affected systems. So far the intensity of the attacks doesn't seem to be escalating.

newsItem.headline: The great-granddaughter of Urizen Kurita dies
newsItem.desc: At the young age of 40, troubled Oma Kurita has passed away. It is said she never really recovered from the ordeal of the attack at the tender age of 18, that claimed most of her close family and resulted in her kidnapping and subsequent pregnancy, and not even being back on her home planet helped her recovery. She leaves a son, Daniel, fathered by her kidnapper.

newsItem.headline: The Andurien War begins
newsItem.desc: Capellan Confederation Armed Forces have arrived in the Andurien system to take it by force. After a few years of relative peace, this treacherous declaration of war by Chancellor Kurnath Liao will not go unpunished. The Captain-General Peter Marik has decided to take the Capellan forces head-on and so, a war begins.

newsItem.headline: A new shuttle introduced, A Life Boat
newsItem.desc: Introducing a new lifesaving vessel for DropShips and JumpShips who suffer accidents in space, we have the Life Boat. This vessel is not designed for reentry or thrust to escape the area. However, with a larger radar signature and solar sail the odds of rescue are increased over previous lifesaving vessels.

newsItem.headline: Regulan Hussars upgraded to brigade size
newsItem.desc: The Regulan Hussars, long a regiment-sized unit of the Principality of Regulus, has been reinforced to brigade size. This is to help it better handle possible invasions from its enemies, the Terran Hegemony.

newsItem.headline: Stinger vs Wasp
newsItem.desc: Earthwerks Inc, announced today the Stinger, a light 'Mech to rival the Wasp as the premier recon 'Mech of the Terran Hegemony.

newsItem.headline: Elizabeth Cameron takes Director-General Position
newsItem.desc: Following a serious health issue, Theodore Cameron has decided to step down from the rigors of the Director-General. His daughter Elizabeth Cameron will be taking over the throne of the Terran Hegemony. We wish the former Director-General a speedy recovery and look forward to the new reign of Elizabeth Cameron.

newsItem.headline: Commando to be Upgraded
newsItem.desc: Following recent advances in both 'Mech design and electronics, Coventry Defense Conglomerate has release news of a new COM-1D variant of their Commando light 'Mech. Sacrificing two tons of armor allows the Commando to carry an SRM-6.

newsItem.headline: Kintetsu Stellar Systems Announces New DropShip
newsItem.desc: Kintetsu Stellar Systems has started production of a new DropShip, the Hoshiryokou. This class of DropShip, while small, can handle 85 tons internally while carrying 10 Cargo containers of 10 tons each.

newsItem.headline: Toro of Taurian Concordat
newsItem.desc: Taurus WarWorks announced today, the Toro TR-A-1. A 35 ton light 'Mech armed with a PPC and two LRM-5s, we see this as a long-range threat in the years to come.

newsItem.headline: Close Range Crossbow
newsItem.desc: In a interesting announcement today, Arcturan Arms announced the introduction of a new variant on their long-range Crossbow 'Mech. The CRS-6C will now be packing an Autocannon/10. However, this comes at the lost of its LRMs and one medium laser. Only time will tell if this new variant will survive the rigors of the battlefield.

newsItem.headline: Brion Marik Re-elected
newsItem.desc: For the second time, Brion Marik has been elected into the Captain-General post.

newsItem.headline: New Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation
newsItem.desc: Raxal Liao has come of age and the Regency has ended. The new Chancellor thanked the Duke of Sian for his service and then promptly stated that he did not wish to rule. The 13th Chancellor stepped down 12 minutes later. He was quoted as saying "I preferred to be a scholar and scientist rather than Chancellor." The 14th Chancellor, Hendrick Liao, has taken over the reins of state with aplomb.

newsItem.headline: Capellan Confederation's Firebee Makeover
newsItem.desc: A second-generation version of the Capellan Confederation's 'Mech has been released. This new 'Mech designated FRB-2E, removes its LRM for two more SRMs and a large laser. Giving it that added long range punch without the limits of ammo.

newsItem.headline: New power in Marik
newsItem.desc: Pounding its way onto the battlefield in Marik Guard colors is the newest BattleMech force outside of the Terran Hegemony's control.

newsItem.headline: First Regulan Hussars attack Lopez
newsItem.desc: The First Regulan Hussars attacked a Capellan Confederation Heavy Tank Regiment marking their first time in combat. However, technical issues along with lack of training resulted in their first lost as well.

newsItem.headline: Fusiliers of Oriente form new unit
newsItem.desc: The Fusilers of Oriente formed the Ducal Guard today.

newsItem.headline: Draconis Combine unveils new DropShip
newsItem.desc: The Draconis Combine announced the Gaajian System Patrol Boat to gathered members of the press today. This new DropShip class will be providing intra-system escort to merchants as well as providing customs and interdiction duties.

newsItem.headline: The Apostle Removed from Service
newsItem.desc: Apostle Self-Propelled Artillery has reached the end of its long and glorious career in the Terran Hegemony today when officials removed it from the TO&E of the military.

newsItem.headline: Commando Upgrade Again?
newsItem.desc: Coventry Defense Conglomerate seeing the tactics of pilots of their light 'Mech has come out with a new variant which increases armor in addition to adding an SRM-4 and replacing its large laser with a medium one.

newsItem.headline: Thorn takes the field, sure to be a pain
newsItem.desc: A new design focused on fire support for recon lances has been fielded over the last few months after successful trials. the Thorn is one of the lightest 'Mechs available at 20 tons but packs not only a pair of medium lasers, but a 5-pack long range missile system to provide a long-range punch for its lance-mates.

newsItem.headline: Mister Watson. Come here. I want to see you.
newsItem.desc: These were the first words successfully sent through the new hyperpulse generator by First Lord Nicholas Cameron himself. The message, sent through this new faster than light communication system, was received immediately. We predict that the implementation of this revolutionary technology will vastly improve interstellar communications, as it can send messages instantaneously at distances of up to 50 light-years.

newsItem.headline: Broadcast Message
newsItem.desc: This is a broadcast test message of the HPG link system.

newsItem.headline: SLDF fields new technology
newsItem.desc: A new era of war-fighting is upon us as one of the most technologically advanced BattleMechs has completed field-testing on Terra. The Exterminator has several new advances integrated that are still listed as classified. While several reports indicate that it will bring about a change in doctrine for several decades, the secrecy lends one to believe that the SLDF has a special mission in mind for this new 'Mech.

newsItem.headline: First Lord names new Director-General
newsItem.desc: A new leader for the Terran Hegemony has been named by the First Lord. Joseph Cameron, son of First Lord Nicholas Cameron, has been named as the Director-General. Having been the subject of some recent scandal, this appointment is a shock to many nobles and rumors are already swirling about additional, potentially embarrassing, details yet to be released.

newsItem.headline: New aerospace fighter takes flight
newsItem.desc: The latest design from Imstar Aerospace recently cleared testing for manufacture. Corporate officials are stating that the Cheetah is aptly named, the fastest aerospace fighter currently available. An anonymous source within Imstar has mentioned that this speed does not come without compromise and that the engine consumes fuel mush more quickly than many other fighters of its size.

newsItem.headline: Amendment passed on Executive Order 34
newsItem.desc: Executive Order 35 has been released to the Houses of the Inner Sphere which amends EO 34 from 2606. This amendment allows for any criminal who attempts to join the SLDF to be denied pending final judicial determination from the appropriate government. This changes the order that no government could interfere with recruiting of SLDF personnel. Several officials stated that it was overdue and that any personnel that used the loophole should be turned back over to the government for trial.

newsItem.headline: New JumpShip launched
newsItem.desc: After several years of design and testing, the Invader-class JumpShip has been launched. Several radical changes from typical design have made this one of the most technologically advanced ships ever seen. Boasting room for over 1,000 tons of cargo and the ability to carry three DropShips, this ship has both commercial and military applications. One notable inclusion is onboard hydroponics facilities for long-term operations away from resupply as well as trade missions to less agriculturally abundant locations.

newsItem.headline: Iona Light Shipyards new fighter dead in space?
newsItem.desc: After several years of design and testing, the Rogue-class JumpShip has been launched. Increasing cost and changes in design, the new aerospace fighter unveiled this year is seeing harsh criticism. Poor maneuverability and reliance on resupply are just two of the many factors that are seen as just more examples of over engineering.

newsItem.headline: Replacement for aging bugs revealed to military commanders
newsItem.desc: An announcement by Mitchell Vehicles has generated mixed feelings about their newest BattleMech chassis. The Mercury was designed to replace older models of the Wasp and Stinger and has left some force commanders wondering if it can stand up to its promises. While the specifics of the new chassis are still being revealed, a press meeting with Mitchell representatives was less than forthcoming stating only that "Mitchell has invested significant resources and technical expertise in the development of this new BattleMech."

newsItem.headline: Factories destroyed on Caph, General Systems in trouble
newsItem.desc: The General Systems factories on Caph are the latest casualties of the ongoing hostilities gripping the Inner Sphere. Material losses are reported to be catastrophic while the human cost is currently being calculated. Forces from several Successor States were involved in a battle that leveled the production facility and the surrounding areas. Bombardments from all sides have turned several populated areas into ruins over the last few months. Capellan forces have since taken the remaining facilities. This facility was the only producer of the Exterminator BattleMech in the Inner Sphere.

newsItem.headline: Time-traveller survivors?
newsItem.desc:
A local pirate faction slated to wither after a successful Lyran raid, has gained a new life when 4000 colonists aboard the colony jumpship Pendragon arrived on system. The kicker? The colonists claim they initiated the jump in 2372! That's right, they claim to have jumped more than 400 years into the future!

The records don't show any proof of the Pendragon crew's claim, but records can be lost and destroyed. Regardless of the veracity of such outlandish events, the pirates on site welcomed the colonists with open arms, sure that they will now prosper in the rich, fertile world.

newsItem.headline: Mercury refits for longer life
newsItem.desc: The Mercury BattleMech, a staple design since 2742 has been the most recent candidate for refits based on the increasing rarity of the original parts. Several systems have been replaced to more common models which has allowed the MCY-98 to increase its armor protection. Unfortunately, these downgrades are removing some of the most prominent features of the speedy 'Mech and leaves pilots relying on that additional protection from enemies they would normally out run."

newsItem.headline: Grand Championship ends, Champion MechWarrior crowned
newsItem.desc: The Solaris VII Grand Championships have come to an end with only Cabol Hirsch standing. After months of grueling matches, the final four MechWarriors brought the Games to a close with explosive results. Several competitors this year had the skills to take the top honor but fell just short as several technical issues plagued Stables. Many owners are calling for investigations as many of the more serious cases involved equipment malfunctions during or prior to matches.

newsItem.headline: Planetary disaster strikes Lone Star
newsItem.desc: The most recent casualty of the Succession Wars has just made its mark on the planet Lone Star. The moon, Vespa, entered the atmosphere earlier this week with devastating results. While it is unclear at this time how many injuries there are, this event will change the face of the planet for generations to come.

newsItem.headline: Morningside Evacuated as Benet III's Toxic Outgassing Worsens: Scientists Debate Ecological Damage
newsItem.desc:
Residents of Morningside, the capital of Benet III, have been ordered to evacuate as the planet's toxic outgassing continues to worsen. Scientists and experts have been monitoring the situation, with some claiming the outgassing is causing significant ecological damage to the planet. However, others argue that it is a natural process that has been occurring for centuries.

Regardless of the cause, the toxic fumes have made living conditions in Morningside unbearable. In an effort to protect the citizens, the local government has ordered an immediate evacuation. The planet's extensive dropship ports, once a strategic advantage, are now being used to transport residents to safety.

The situation on Benet III has raised many questions about the safety and sustainability of human settlements on the planet. The evacuation serves as a reminder of the delicate balance between industrial development and environmental preservation.

newsItem.headline: Marik forces destroyed after fleeing Solaris
newsItem.desc:
Filed 02 April 2903

There is muted celebration on Solaris VII today as the war criminals from the Free Worlds League were immediately and irrevocably destroyed during a failed jump out of the system. The ship, Despiser, opened fire on the world with nuclear weapons before attempting to flee. A failed jump resulted in the destroyer breaking up above the planet in an incredible display of light. While there is no current accounting of casualties, the areas around Xolara are currently being treated as a hazardous zone and all emergency personnel responding to the incident are required to have the maximum level of protective gear.

newsItem.headline: Ruins to hold classes once again
newsItem.desc: Reconstruction has completed on a facility almost entirely destroyed in 2865. The rebuilt facility, now named the Dover Institute of Higher Learning, is slated to begin its first classes later this year. The Dover Institute of Higher Learning is to be a centre of learning and training to ensure the Combine is ready for the years to come, home to a technician school, an engineering school, a medical school, and even a small but elite MechWarrior training program. The curriculum is anticipated to be extremely intense, to produce elite graduates for the glory of the Draconis Combine.

newsItem.headline: Parliament seeks restitution from First Lord and Captain-General
newsItem.desc:
Filed 12 September 2989

Parliament is setting a new precedent by demanding restitution from the First Lord and Captain-General and the military as a whole to replenish funds used during the recent wars. Special Resolution 512 calls for funds, materials, and equipment to be disbursed back into the FWL economy to help bolster those industries most effected by the fighting. No official word from the office of the First Lord. Economists are following this news intently as these reparations could significantly bolster struggling economies across the FWL.

newsItem.headline: New Commander of the Otomo
newsItem.desc:
Filed 01 January 3000

Takashi Kurita has served with honor and distinction with the Second Sword of Light. For his service, the Coordinator has promoted Kurita Takashi-sama to the rank of sho-sho and named his voice in High Command of the Arm of the Dragon. The Coordinator further showed his trust of Kurita Takashi-sama by naming him commander of the Otomo, charged with the safety of the Imperial Place here on Luthien.

newsItem.headline: Kalidasa's 'Mech Factory Assaulted
newsItem.desc:
Filed 23 January 3000
